reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful room, but the service is completely bizarre -- either my husband & I were invisible to anyone who appeared to work at the hotel, or they were entirely indifferent to their guests. Breakfast was so-so -- really surprised that an inn of this level would serve Hungry Jack maple syrup... Still, there's free tea and coffee, a nice bar area, and again, spectactular (and agreeably funky) rooms -- just be prepared for the entirely amateur/ indifferent service.
reviews.title: Indifferent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My hustand and I spent one night at the Ledgelawn during a recent stay in BarHarbor. We had an $80 room on the third floor walkup. The room could have used some love and care, but it was clean and quiet. The inn staff were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast was somewhat nasty, but we were happy with the price we paid for the room, so were not to upset about the stale buffet eggs. The inn is located within a quick walk to all the great restaurants in town. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay
Big Ripoff
reviews.text: This is a big old rundown hotel that needed thorough renovation years ago. It looks good at first sight, but when you look closer you see very shoddy and worn woodwork and appointments that may well have come from the local dump or flea market. For us it started when I noticed a very rapid drip coming from the bathroom ceiling. The staff responded quickly (some staff work very hard to overcome the aging facilities with inferior maintenance equipment) and a repairman came in brandishing a hot glue gun which he apparently used to fix the leak upstairs. It was obvious that this problem had occurred before with lots of black mold and old repairs visible.
